info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 8:19PM PST until January 16 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...A wintry mix of precipitation is expected with periods of snow and freezing rain or sleet. Total snow accumulations of around one inch. Ice accumulations from a light glaze to a few hundreths of an inch. Winds gusting 25 to 35 mph over the mountains. * WHERE...Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. This includes Chemult, Crescent, Highway 97 across northern Klamath County and Highway 31 in far northwest Lake and far northeast Klamath counties. This also includes higher terrain in eastern Klamath and western Lake County. * WHEN...From noon to 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wintry mix of precipitation is expected to change to a mix of rain and snow Tuesday evening and night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
